meanings.definition: To perform a lobotomy on (a person)
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to lobotomise the patient to treat their severe mental illness.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon decided to lobotomise the patient to alleviate their symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would lobotomise himself if he forgot his own punchline.
meanings.sent4: The idea of having to lobotomise my own thoughts felt like erasing a part of myself.
meanings.sent5: The image of the doctor's tools ready to lobotomise was unsettling.

meanings.definition: To severely reduce the mental or emotional capacity of (a person)
meanings.sent1: The traumatic event seemed to lobotomise her ability to trust others.
meanings.sent2: The constant stress began to lobotomise his once vibrant personality.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture threatened to lobotomise the students' interest in the subject.
meanings.sent4: The toxic relationship slowly started to lobotomise her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments seemed to lobotomise his confidence over time.
